intro: Anaitis, commonly known as the ghost flower, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale in color. The leaves are usually pinnately divided, giving the plant a delicate and fern-like appearance. Anaitis species are often found in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. These plants are known for their short blooming period and their ability to thrive in nutrient-poor soils.
